question: A work can be completed by P and Q in 12 days, Q and R in 15 days, R and P in 20 days. In how many days P alone can complete the work ?
explanation:
(P + Q)\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{12}&s=1$……….(I)
(Q + R)\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{15}&s=1$…….….(II)
(R + P)\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{20}&s=1$……….(III)
On adding, 
2(P + Q + R)\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{12}+\\frac{1}{15}+\\frac{1}{20} = \\frac{5+4+3}{60} = \\frac{1}{5}&s=1$
∴ (P + Q + R)\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{5\\times 2} = \\frac{1}{10}&s=1$……….(IV)
∴ P\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{10}-\\frac{1}{15} = \\frac{3-2}{20} = \\frac{1}{30}&s=1$
∴ P alone will complete the work in 30 days.
Hence option [C] is correct answer.
